name: Andy Warhol
title: The First Pop Art Superstar
livesSummary: An American artist, film director, and producer who was a leading figure in the visual art movement known as pop art. His works explore the relationship between artistic expression, advertising, and celebrity culture.
reasonBehindTitle: He challenged traditional notions of art by embracing commercial culture, mass production, and celebrity. His Factory studio became a cultural hotspot, and his '15 minutes of fame' concept defined a modern obsession.
lessons: Art is everywhere and everything is art. The line between commerce and art is blurrier than we think.
youtubeTitle: Soup Cans & Superstars: The Andy Warhol Story

name: Coco Chanel
title: The First Modern Woman's Designer
livesSummary: A French fashion designer and businesswoman. The founder and namesake of the Chanel brand, she was credited in the post-World War I era with liberating women from the constraints of the 'corseted silhouette' and popularizing a sporty, casual chic as the feminine standard of style.
reasonBehindTitle: She introduced the 'little black dress', trousers for women, and costume jewelry, fundamentally changing what was considered acceptable and fashionable for women to wear, setting a trend for comfort and understated elegance.
lessons: Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance. To be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
youtubeTitle: Chanel: A Woman of Her Own

name: DJ Kool Herc
title: The Father of Hip Hop
livesSummary: A Jamaican-American DJ who is credited for originating hip hop music in the Bronx, New York City, in the 1970s. His 'Merry-Go-Round' technique of using two turntables to extend the 'break' of a song was revolutionary.
reasonBehindTitle: By isolating and looping the instrumental breaks of funk records, he created the foundational rhythm of hip hop, providing the soundscape for a new generation of MCs and B-boys and sparking a global cultural movement.
lessons: Innovation often comes from re-purposing existing tools in a new way. The most powerful movements start in the streets.
youtubeTitle: The Break: How Kool Herc Created Hip Hop
